comment.author: 8481360@N04
comment._content: I find it amazing that the women wore the restricting white dresses to go bushwalking.  Granted that women of that era knew no other way but this way, I admire them!

comment.author: 8822983@N08
comment._content: Rodriguez Pass is a walking track linking the base of Govetts Leap to the  base of Evans Lookout. Named after Tomas Ramon Rodriquez (1869-1929) born in Santo Domingo, he promoted the walking track which bears his name. Rodriquez was station master for Blackheath in 1890 also a hotel proprietor and real estate agent and councillor on the Blue Mountains Shire Council 1917-1919. Total cost of the track was 270 pounds of which the government provided a 50% subsidy; it was completed on 21st April 1900. Ref. Blue Mountains Geographical Dictionary, Brian Fox
